predicate.note: Frames file for 'triumph' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

example.name: just winner
example.text: Unlike other writers who either battled the fascists during the Civil War, or left Spain when Franco triumphed [*T*-2], Mr. Cela fought briefly on the general's side, no doubt earning with his war wound some forbearance when he went on to depict a country with a high population of vagabonds, murderers and rural idiots trudging aimlessly through a dried-out land.

example.name: winner and competition
example.text: So much, too, for the notion that we humans triumphed in the Darwinian struggle by [*-1] evolving big brains.
